mainBoard.name: Elspeth Resplendent
mainBoard.originalText:
+1: Choose up to one target creature. Put a +1/+1 counter and a counter from among flying, first strike, lifelink, or vigilance on it.
−3: Look at the top seven cards of your library. You may put a permanent card with mana value 3 or less from among them onto the battlefield with a shield counter on it. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in a random order.
−7: Create five 3/3 white Angel creature tokens with flying.

rulings.text: A creature with a shield counter on it may still be destroyed by state-based actions if it has damage marked on it equal to its toughness or has been dealt unpreventable damage by a source with deathtouch.
For Elspeth's first ability, its controller chooses flying, first strike, lifelink, or vigilance, then that counter and the +1/+1 counter are placed on the target creature at the same time.
If a permanent that would be dealt damage has more than one shield counter on it, that damage is prevented and only one shield counter is removed.
If a permanent with a shield counter is dealt unpreventable damage, that damage will be dealt and a shield counter will still be removed.
Removing a shield counter in this way isn't the same as regenerating a creature.
Shield counters don't prevent players from sacrificing creatures.

“Shield” is not an ability that creatures have and shield counters are not keyword counters. If a creature with a shield counter loses its abilities, the shield counter will still protect it as normal.

mainBoard.name: Lion Sash

rulings.text: Although it causes an Equipment to become attached to a creature, reconfigure is not an “equip ability” for the purpose of cards like Fighter Class and Leonin Shikari.
An Equipment creature can never become attached to itself. If an effect tries to do this, nothing happens.
An Equipment creature with reconfigure can be attached to creatures by effects other than its reconfigure ability, such as the activated ability of Brass Squire.

An Equipment doesn't become tapped when the permanent it's attached to becomes tapped. For example, if you attack with a creature that is equipped with Acquisition Octopus, then use reconfigure to unattach Acquisition Octopus after combat, the Octopus will be untapped and could be used to block during your opponent's turn.

As soon as an Equipment creature with reconfigure stops being a creature, any Equipment and Auras with enchant creature abilities become unattached. Auras that can enchant an Equipment that isn't a creature remain attached to it.
Attaching an Equipment with reconfigure to a creature causes that Equipment to stop being a creature until it becomes unattached. It also loses any creature subtypes it had.

If a permanent with reconfigure is somehow still a creature after it becomes attached (perhaps due to an effect like that of March of the Machines), it immediately becomes unattached from the equipped creature.
If an Equipment with reconfigure somehow loses its abilities while it is attached, the effect causing it to not be a creature continues to apply until it becomes unattached.

Reconfigure represents two activated abilities. Reconfigure [cost] means “[Cost]: Attach this permanent to another target creature you control. Activate only as a sorcery,” and “[Cost]: Unattach this permanent. Activate only if this permanent is attached to a creature and only as a sorcery.”

Similarly, if an Equipment is tapped, its reconfigure abilities may still be activated and it may still become attached to creatures. Becoming attached doesn't untap it. In most cases, an attached Equipment being tapped won't affect gameplay, but it will be relevant if it becomes unattached again before it untaps.

mainBoard.name: Parish-Blade Trainee

rulings.text: A creature's training ability triggers only when both that creature and a creature with greater power are declared as attackers. Increasing a creature's power after attackers are declared won't cause a training ability to trigger.
If Parish-Blade Trainee has -1/-1 counters on it when it dies, the last ability will include those as well. This may result in the recipient also dying.

In some unusual cases, you may end up putting the appropriate counters on more than one permanent. For example, if you control The Ozolith when Parish-Blade Trainee dies, you'll put the appropriate number of each kind of counter onto both The Ozolith and the target creature.
Once a creature's training ability has triggered, destroying the other attacking creature or reducing its power won't stop the creature with training from getting a +1/+1 counter.

Parish-Blade Trainee's last ability doesn't cause you to move counters from itself to the target creature. Rather, you put the same number of each kind of counter Parish-Blade Trainee had when it died onto that creature.
Parish-Blade Trainee's last ability puts all of its counters onto the target creature, not just its +1/+1 counters.

mainBoard.text:
Training (Whenever this creature attacks with another creature with greater power, put a +1/+1 counter on this creature.)
When Parish-Blade Trainee dies, put its counters on target creature you control.

mainBoard.name: Raffine's Informant
mainBoard.originalText: When Raffine's Informant enters the battlefield, it connives. (Draw a card, then discard a card. If you discarded a nonland card, put a +1/+1 counter on this creature.)

rulings.text: If a resolving spell or ability instructs a specific creature to connive but that creature has left the battlefield, the creature still connives. If you discard a nonland card this way, you won't put a +1/+1 counter on anything. Abilities that trigger “when [that creature] connives” will trigger.
If no card is discarded, most likely because that player's hand is empty and an effect says they can't draw cards, the conniving creature does not receive a +1/+1 counter.

Once an ability that causes a creature to connive begins to resolve, no player may take any other actions until it's done. Notably, opponents can't try to remove the conniving creature after you discard a nonland card but before it receives a counter.

mainBoard.name: Undercover Operative
mainBoard.originalText: You may have Undercover Operative enter the battlefield as a copy of any creature on the battlefield, except it enters with a shield counter on it if you control that creature. (If it would be dealt damage or destroyed, remove a shield counter from it instead.)

rulings.text: A creature with a shield counter on it may still be destroyed by state-based actions if it has damage marked on it equal to its toughness or has been dealt unpreventable damage by a source with deathtouch.
If a permanent that would be dealt damage has more than one shield counter on it, that damage is prevented and only one shield counter is removed.
If a permanent with a shield counter is dealt unpreventable damage, that damage will be dealt and a shield counter will still be removed.
Removing a shield counter in this way isn't the same as regenerating a creature.
Shield counters don't prevent players from sacrificing creatures.

“Shield” is not an ability that creatures have and shield counters are not keyword counters. If a creature with a shield counter loses its abilities, the shield counter will still protect it as normal.

mainBoard.name: Homestead Courage

rulings.text: "Flashback [cost]" means "You may cast this card from your graveyard by paying [cost] rather than paying its mana cost" and "If the flashback cost was paid, exile this card instead of putting it anywhere else any time it would leave the stack."
A spell cast using flashback will always be exiled afterward, whether it resolves, is countered, or leaves the stack in some other way.
If a card with flashback is put into your graveyard during your turn, you can cast it if it's legal to do so before any other player can take any actions.

To determine the total cost of a spell, start with the mana cost or alternative cost (such as a flashback cost) you're paying, add any cost increases, then apply any cost reductions. The mana value of the spell is determined only by its mana cost, no matter what the total cost to cast the spell was.
You can cast a spell using flashback even if it was somehow put into your graveyard without having been cast.

You must still follow any timing restrictions and permissions, including those based on the card's type. For instance, you can cast a sorcery using flashback only when you could normally cast a sorcery.

mainBoard.name: Borrowed Time

rulings.text: Auras attached to the exiled permanent will be put into their owners' graveyards. Equipment attached to an exiled creature will become unattached and remain on the battlefield. Any counters on the exiled permanent will cease to exist.

Borrowed Time's ability is a single ability that creates two one-shot effects: one that exiles the permanent when the ability resolves, and another that returns the exiled card to the battlefield immediately after Borrowed Time leaves the battlefield.
If Borrowed Time leaves the battlefield before its enters-the-battlefield ability resolves, the target permanent won't be exiled.
If a token is exiled, it ceases to exist. It won't be returned to the battlefield.

In a multiplayer game, if Borrowed Time's owner leaves the game, the exiled card will return to the battlefield. Because the one-shot effect that returns the card isn't an ability that goes on the stack, it won't cease to exist along with the leaving player's spells and abilities on the stack.

잔잔한 만은 탭된 채로 전장에 들어온다.
잔잔한 만이 전장에 들어올 때, 당신은 생명 1점을 얻는다.
{T}: {W} 또는 {U}를 추가한다.

foreignData.name: Angra Tranquila
foreignData.text:
Angra Tranquila entra no campo de batalha virada.
Quando Angra Tranquila entra no campo de batalha, você ganha 1 ponto de vida.
{T}: Adicione {W} ou {U}.

foreignData.name: Тихая Бухта
foreignData.text:
Тихая Бухта выходит на поле битвы повернутой.
Когда Тихая Бухта выходит на поле битвы, вы получаете 1 жизнь.
{T}: добавьте {W} или {U}.

foreignData.name: 静谧海湾
foreignData.text:
静谧海湾须横置进战场。
当静谧海湾进战场时，你获得1点生命。
{T}：加{W}或{U}。

foreignData.name: 靜謐海灣
foreignData.text:
靜謐海灣須橫置進戰場。
當靜謐海灣進戰場時，你獲得1點生命。
{T}：加{W}或{U}。

mainBoard.name: Tranquil Cove
mainBoard.text:
Tranquil Cove enters tapped.
When Tranquil Cove enters, you gain 1 life.
{T}: Add {W} or {U}.

mainBoard.flavorText: Drownyard floods and unnatural frost made the once peaceful boardwalk deceptively treacherous.

foreignData.flavorText: Fluten im Unterwassergrab und unnatürlicher Frost haben den einst friedlichen Holzsteg tückisch morsch werden lassen.
foreignData.name: Verlassener Strand
foreignData.text:
Der Verlassene Strand kommt getappt ins Spiel, es sei denn, du kontrollierst zwei oder mehr andere Länder.
{T}: Erzeuge {W} oder {U}.

foreignData.flavorText: Las inundaciones y heladas contranaturales del cementerio marino transformaron en un peligro traicionero a la tranquila pasarela de antaño.
foreignData.name: Playa desierta
foreignData.text:
La Playa desierta entra al campo de batalla girada a menos que controles otras dos o más tierras.
{T}: Agrega {W} o {U}.

foreignData.flavorText: Les inondations du cimetière marin et le gel surnaturel avaient fait de la promenade jadis si paisible un endroit traître et dangereux.
foreignData.name: Plage désertée
foreignData.text:
La Plage désertée arrive sur le champ de bataille engagée à moins que vous ne contrôliez au moins deux autres terrains.
{T} : Ajoutez {W} ou {U}.

foreignData.flavorText: Gli allagamenti della Relittopoli e il gelo innaturale avevano reso il pontile, un tempo pacifico, sorprendentemente pericoloso.
foreignData.name: Spiaggia Deserta
foreignData.text:
La Spiaggia Deserta entra nel campo di battaglia TAPpata a meno che tu non controlli altre due o più terre.
{T}: Aggiungi {W} o {U}.

foreignData.flavorText: 溺墓の洪水や不自然な霜によって、一時は平和的だった遊歩道が今は予想外で危険な場所に成り果てた。
foreignData.name: さびれた浜
foreignData.text:
あなたがこれでない２つ以上の土地をコントロールしていないかぎり、さびれた浜はタップ状態で戦場に出る。
{T}：{W}か{U}を加える。

foreignData.flavorText: 수장된 묘지에서 발생하는 홍수와 자연스럽지 못한 서리가 한때는 평화로웠던 판잣길을 눈에 보이는 것과는 달리 위험하게 만들었다.
foreignData.name: 버려진 해변
foreignData.text:
버려진 해변은 당신이 다른 대지를 두 개 이상 조종하지 않는 한 탭된 채로 전장에 들어온다.
{T}: {W} 또는 {U}를 추가한다.

foreignData.flavorText: As inundações e o congelamento antinatural na Costa Náufraga tornaram traiçoeiros caminhos outrora pacíficos.
foreignData.name: Praia Deserta
foreignData.text:
Praia Deserta entra no campo de batalha virada, a menos que você controle dois ou mais outros terrenos.
{T}: Adicione {W} ou {U}.

foreignData.flavorText: Затопленные кладбища и неестественные морозы сделали этот некогда безмятежный пляжный променад обманчиво вероломным.
foreignData.name: Пустынный Пляж
foreignData.text:
Пустынный Пляж выходит на поле битвы повернутым, если под вашим контролем менее двух других земель.
{T}: добавьте {W} или {U}.

foreignData.flavorText: 沉船地的洪流和诡异冰霜，让这原本平稳的木板路径也变得颇为凶险。
foreignData.name: 荒废沙滩
foreignData.text:
除非你操控两个或更多其他地，否则荒废沙滩须横置进战场。
{T}：加{W}或{U}。

foreignData.flavorText: 沉船地的洪流和詭異冰霜，讓這原本平穩的木板路徑也變得頗為凶險。
foreignData.name: 荒廢沙灘
foreignData.text:
除非你操控兩個或更多其他地，否則荒廢沙灘須橫置進戰場。
{T}：加{W}或{U}。

mainBoard.name: Deserted Beach

rulings.text: If this land enters the battlefield at the same time as any number of other lands, those other lands are not counted when determining if this land enters the battlefield tapped or untapped.

mainBoard.text:
Deserted Beach enters tapped unless you control two or more other lands.
{T}: Add {W} or {U}.

mainBoard.flavorText: New Capenna's districts are a series of tiers; wealth and power always rise to the top.

foreignData.flavorText: Die Bezirke von Neu-Capenna sind stufenförmig angeordnet. Wohlstand und Macht nehmen nach oben hin immer mehr zu.
foreignData.name: Himmelsbrücken-Türme
foreignData.text:
Die Himmelsbrücken-Türme kommen getappt ins Spiel.
{T}: Erzeuge {W} oder {U}.
{2}{W}{U}, {T}, opfere die Himmelsbrücken-Türme: Ziehe eine Karte.

foreignData.flavorText: Los distritos de Nueva Capenna están divididos por rangos. El dinero y el poder siempre están en lo más alto.
foreignData.name: Torres con puentes elevados
foreignData.text:
Las Torres con puentes elevados entran al campo de batalla giradas.
{T}: Agrega {W} o {U}.
{2}{W}{U}, {T}, sacrificar las Torres con puentes elevados: Roba una carta.

foreignData.flavorText: Les quartiers de la Nouvelle-Capenna sont une série de niveaux ; la fortune et la puissance montent toujours au sommet.
foreignData.name: Tours du Pont céleste
foreignData.text:
Les Tours du Pont céleste arrivent sur le champ de bataille engagées.
{T} : Ajoutez {W} ou {U}.
{2}{W}{U}, {T}, sacrifiez les Tours du Pont céleste : Piochez une carte.

foreignData.flavorText: I quartieri di Nuova Capenna sono una serie di livelli; ricchezza e potere si elevano sempre verso il vertice.
foreignData.name: Torri dei Ponti Aerei
foreignData.text:
Le Torri dei Ponti Aerei entrano nel campo di battaglia TAPpate.
{T}: Aggiungi {W} o {U}.
{2}{W}{U}, {T}, Sacrifica le Torri dei Ponti Aerei: Pesca una carta.

foreignData.flavorText: ニューカペナの地区は階層構造になっている。富と権力が常に頂上に登り詰めるのだ。
foreignData.name: 天橋塔
foreignData.text:
天橋塔はタップ状態で戦場に出る。
{T}：{W}か{U}を加える。
{2}{W}{U}, {T}, 天橋塔を生け贄に捧げる：カード１枚を引く。

foreignData.flavorText: 뉴 카펜나의 구역들은 일련의 계층으로 나뉘어 있고, 부와 권력이 항상 그 정상을 차지한다.
foreignData.name: 하늘다리 탑
foreignData.text:
하늘다리 탑은 탭된 채로 전장에 들어온다.
{T}: {W} 또는 {U}를 추가한다.
{2}{W}{U}, {T}, 하늘다리 탑을 희생한다: 카드 한 장을 뽑는다.

foreignData.flavorText: Os distritos de Nova Capenna são uma série de níveis. A riqueza e o poder sempre afluem para o topo.
foreignData.name: Torres da Ponte Celeste
foreignData.text:
Torres da Ponte Celeste entra no campo de batalha virada.
{T}: Adicione {W} ou {U}.
{2}{W}{U}, {T}, sacrifique Torres da Ponte Celeste: Compre um card.

foreignData.flavorText: Районы Новой Капенны располагаются ярусами, где богатство и власть всегда стремятся на самый верх.
foreignData.name: Башни Небесного Моста
foreignData.text:
Башни Небесного Моста выходят на поле битвы повернутыми.
{T}: добавьте {W} или {U}.
{2}{W}{U}, {T}, пожертвуйте Башни Небесного Моста: возьмите карту.

foreignData.flavorText: 新卡佩纳的地区按层分级，富人和权贵总是在顶部。
foreignData.name: 空桥高塔
foreignData.text:
空桥高塔须横置进战场。
{T}：加{W}或{U}。
{2}{W}{U}，{T}，牺牲空桥高塔：抓一张牌。

foreignData.flavorText: 新卡佩納的地區按層分級，富人和權貴總是在頂部。
foreignData.name: 空橋高塔
foreignData.text:
空橋高塔須橫置進戰場。
{T}：加{W}或{U}。
{2}{W}{U}，{T}，犧牲空橋高塔：抽一張牌。
